titleStmt.title: Selections from the Clarence T. Arai Papers
titleStmt.author: Clarence T. Arai
titleStmt.sponsor: University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Washington Student Project for TXTDS 404: Texts, Publics, and Publication

bibl.title: Clarence T. Arai Papers
bibl.author: Clarence T. Arai
bibl.pubPlace: University of Washington, Special Collections Manuscripts and Archives
bibl.note: This scrapbook, assembled by Clarence T. Arai, provides a perspective on his life as a Japanese American in Seattle before and during World War II. It includes correspondences, newspaper clippings, certificates, and other artifacts Arai selected to preserve.

encodingDesc.p: This edition focuses on a selection of pages from Clarence T. Araiâ€™s scrapbook held in the University of Washington Special Collections.

We chose to work with a scrapbook because of the vulnerability conveyed through its visual and textual features. This edition, only a small selection of pieces from the full work, explores the choices Arai made in assembling his scrapbook, considering how these preserved materials capture a personal experience during World War II and contribute to a more holistic, human understanding of the period.
